document: @gregthobbs @DianeFuller001 So sorry to hear about your sad loss... I agree about bacon (makes Homer Simpson drooling face)... but I agree even more about talking & sharing our problems. Well done for reaching out 🤗 Stay strong, this too shall pass 💐
RT @claremackint0sh: Britain has reached not-even-taking-a-cardigan-just-in-case levels of weather complacency.

RT @mandystevens22: This is what #anxietyfeelslike

➡️Normal me going to visit a friend: 
Picks up car keys or Oyster card & leaves

➡️Anxi…
RT @alicelouisjulie: A wonderful smile from our Chief Nurse. Thank you for popping in to our Nursing Informatics lectures. Surely we are al…

#anxietyfeelslike

*Spend about an hour writing over-apologetic text message to friend to cancel visit

*feel about a million times worse & spend the whole day crying, wishing I was with my friend

*avoids friend for over a week due to guilt & embarrassment

#welcometomyworld

#anxietyfeelslike

*3-4 hours lying in bed, constant anxious battle in my head

*repeat journey decision cycle at increasingly high speed 🔄🔄🔄

*pulse races, starts hyperventilating, feels faint

*starts crying

⚠️ F**k it...  I’m not going

#anxietyfeelslike 

-Repeats “shall I drive or get the train?” multiple times

*feels sick, develops headache, starts sweating

*says horrible, unkind & unpleasant things to myself

-Im a failure, Im stupid, Im an idiot <insert lots of awful swear words>

-decide Im a crap friend

#anxietyfeelslike

On the day of the journey:

*wakes at 3am worrying about what time to leave so I’m not late for a short visit to my friends

-I think I’ll get the train
-no... I’ll drive 

-I said I’d be there at 11am; it’s a 40 min journey so I’ll leave at 8am so I’m not late

#anxietyfeelslike

*opens ‘notes’ & spends 30 minutes writing a detailed ‘pros & cons’ list for driving or train decision

*studies list, travel apps & screenshots of possible journey/routes/times

*does this at least once an hour for the whole day before the visit

#anxietyfeelslike

-but what if there’s lots of traffic?
-What if I break down?
-I won’t be able to cope

*studies Waze app & Google maps for 25 minutes, scratching head & feeling sick

*Puts down phone for 2 or 3 minutes
*picks up phone again & studies all open travel apps

#anxietyfeelslike

-but if I get the train then something might happen & I’ve got to get a connecting bus too

*studies TfL app for about 20 minutes looking at different routes & times & taking screenshots

-sod that... I’ll drive. Probably.

This is what #anxietyfeelslike

➡️Normal me going to visit a friend: 
Picks up car keys or Oyster card & leaves

➡️Anxious me 24-48 hours before going to visit the same friend:
🤔Shall I drive or get the train?

-If I drive then what if I feel ill?
-ok, I’ll get the train

@UMAgbas Wow... looking fantastic Ugochi! 👌🏻 good job 💐
RT @MegansStarr: You may appear to have it all on the outside, but nobody knows what struggles are hidden by the fake smile & outward facad…
@SWLSTG My favourite is whichever cake Victoria @vfgsunflowers made 😋 great selection tho... well done team xx
@Sonia_Sparkles @BTHFT @karendawber @65_susan @QIBradford1 @ChiomaO_QI @BTHFT_Transform @AMGillespie1 Ooooh... love a good spc chart 👌🏻 great work team 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻 love the downward trajectory 📉

RT @honestrecovery: I feel flat and numb and angry. I am impatient. I don't care. I feel like a battery running low.

I was too positive on…
RT @honestrecovery: Anxiety stopped me doing loads of 'normal' things: get my hair cut, go shopping, go out with friends, go to work, cook…
@honestrecovery And for the record (a) nothing has been jinxed (b) life isn’t pointless. Keep hope inside you; hope for recovery & hope/knowledge that you will be 💯% YOU again soon 💐

@honestrecovery Really helpful, honest post Becky & thanks for sharing. When depression & anxiety work together on us they are a formidable negative force 👹👹 work hard on self-compassion, reach out to people & do things (even little things) that make you happy. It’s hard, but worth it 🌚➡️🌝

Thank you all for the love, it means so much

Self esteem drops quickly with #depression; I described myself as a burden last week

Yesterday I felt surrounded by support, encouragement & compassion. Maybe Im not such a burden after all

Normal service will resume shortly🌚➡️🌝

Just emptied my handbag from yesterday’s #NHS70 conference #NursingMidwiferyLondon

~4 pens
~a key ring
~bus pass holder
~6 badges
~a triangular highlighter
~a linen bag
~5 lanyards

What, no post-it notes?😳

Once a nurse, always a nurse #oldhabitsdiehard

✳️5/5
But the world didn’t stop turning, my tears dried up, my anxiety subsided & I was fine again

Massive thanks to @DannGooding @BrianwDolan @Jonatha85888249 @CAlexanderNHS @ShanleyOliver & others for accepting & supporting me ❤️

& @Liz_ORiordan for ongoing inspiration💐

✳️4/5
I held it together nearly all day, then it all became a bit overwhelming at the end 

I sat at the front of the huge conference hall with tears rolling down my cheeks😢 anxiety bubbling up inside me, wishing the ground would swallow me up 😔🙈

✳️3/5
Although anxious about co-Chairing the #NursingMidwiferyLondon #NHS70 yesterday, the phenomenal outpouring of love & support as well as all the kindness, warmth & hugs I was showered with yesterday shows that it really is ok to be honest about our #mentalhealth

✳️2/5
@Liz_ORiordan a breast cancer surgeon & a remarkable woman, has recently spoken openly about recurrence of her breast cancer

So I the spirit of openness I shared yesterday that I’ve recently relapsed with #depression & #anxiety

It highlights that no one is invincible

✳️1/5
I was very moved sharing the stage last year with @Liz_ORiordan discussing

“When NHS staff become patients“ @NuffieldTrust

I found Liz’s story so touching; 
we know our illnesses inside out, we understand the treatment & the prognosis, but we still feel vulnerable & ill https://t.co/Z8kWqfMMpA

@DannGooding @MRadford_DONi @ShanleyOliver @NHSEngland @horizonsnhs @jimgblair @BernellBussue @CAlexanderNHS @ph_wilson1 You were great today @DannGooding ... really great. You held the audience & spoke well. Your summary & reflection of the day was profound, passionate & professional. I’d share the stage with you again any day ⭐️ & thanks a million for your support too xx

@SueMarsden6 Lol re hammer! Thanks for your kind words... yes, I’ve got my #recovery box out and updated my recovery plan. Hard to do all this when feeling 💩 but I know it’s 100% worth the effort 👌🏻
@williams_lucie Thanks so much Lucie 😊 I really appreciate that xx

Matron Dympna Mangan talking about team work, leadership & improvement in challenging wards

~ consistently engage with your team
~ monitor KPIs closely
~ enable local leadership to thrive
~ manage staff
~ engage other resources to support the team

#NursingMidwiferyLondon #NHS70
@Com651 I’m not feeling too fabulous at the moment 🤦🏻‍♀️... but will do soon 😊 Thanks for your kind words x

@JaneEAppleton Thanks very much @JaneEAppleton ... it’s harder to do it in practice! Honesty can be difficult when depression & anxiety are whispering lies in your ear 👹 I guess I want to lead by example & remind others that #depression is a treatable illness 🌚➡️🌝

@trueman_Selina 👋🏻👋🏻👋🏻 cooeeee Selina, I’m here too

#toptips for success for leading for improvement in challenging clinical areas: 

✅Be human
✅Build on what works well
✅Identify barriers & solutions
✅Be approachable & reliable 
✅Don’t be fearful of being honest

#NursingMidwideryLondon
#NHS70
